# tabView(_:willSelect:)

**Instance Method**

Informs the tab view controller that the specified tab is about to be selected.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func tabView(_ tabView: NSTabView, willSelect tabViewItem: NSTabViewItem?)
```

## Parameters

- **tabView**: The tab view object whose tab is about to be selected.
- **tabViewItem**: The tab view item that will be selected.

## Discussion

This method is a delegate method called by the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTabView] object when changes occur. Use it to update your UI or perform any tasks before a tab is selected.

If you override this method, you must call `super` at some point in your implementation.

## Responding to Tab View Events

- **viewDidLoad()**: Called after the view controller’s view has been loaded into memory.
- **tabView(_:shouldSelect:)**: Asks the tab view controller if the specified tab should be selected.
- **tabView(_:didSelect:)**: Informs the tab view controller that the specified tab was selected.
